Legal_Issue: Whether the applicants have a well-founded fear of persecution based on religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group
Application_Facts: Applicants faced discrimination in Israel; incidents included school bullying and stoning; objections to military service were known prior to immigration; exemptions available
Decision_Outcome: Refugee Division's decision was reasonable; application for judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Refugee Division's denial of refugee status
Grounds_for_Claim: Perceived persecution in Israel based on religion and nationality
Legal_Standard: Persecution involves sustained or systemic human rights violations demonstrating state protection failure; discrimination does not automatically constitute persecution
Assessment_Factor: Severity of incidents; state response; availability of protection; prior knowledge of military service obligations
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Refugee Division's decision
Evidence_Used: Reports of school bullying, stoning, objections to military service
Application_Basis: Well-founded fear of persecution under Canadian refugee law
Evidence_Assessed: Incidents treated as minor by authorities; lack of evidence of state inability to protect
Governing_Rule: Under Canadian refugee law, persecution requires sustained or systemic violations and failure of state protection
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove state inability to protect; minor nature of incidents
Outcome: Application dismissed; no well-founded fear of persecution established
Harm_Assessment: Discrimination experienced but not rising to level of persecution
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status due to perceived persecution in Israel based on religion and nationality
Evidence_Handling: Authorities addressed incidents as minor; no systemic neglect shown
Evidence_Issues: Lack of evidence showing state failure to protect
Evidence_Assessment: Incidents not sufficient to establish persecution; state protection found adequate
Decision_Rationale: The Refugee Division's decision was reasonable; applicants did not demonstrate a well-founded fear of persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to prove persecution or lack of state protection
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution requiring sustained or systemic human rights violations and state protection failure
